reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first time visiting Galway and sadly probably our last! What can I say.... Awful hotel, awful receptionist so bad that we checked out at 11pm and drove 3 hours back to Cork. To start the rooms are old fashioned, miserable and kinda depressing! Dont expect to have a restful stay because the music will keep you awake for most of the night. The receptionist was so rude and unsympathetic when we checked out that I was forced to write a letter of complaint when we got home. I have never written a letter of complaint! I received a reply letter about a week later and all I can say is it was a pathetic apology and a she attached a copy of our booking reference which stated that 'there was a bar in the hotel and that you may experience some noise'. SOME NOISE.. Come on? We have stayed in plenty of hotels which have bars and nightclubs but you dont expect to feel like your sleeping on the dancefloor!!
reviews.title: Please Dont Stay Here!

reviews.text: So please please please dont stay here it was the worst experience of our lives.
reviews.title: A nice place if you're not too picky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Five of us stayed here last March for a girly weekend away. We got a good two night deal B&B with one evening meal included so didn't care once we had a bed to sleep in. Rooms are clean and average, no view but then again you're in a city so who spends much time in the room. I would definitely stay here again, you can't beat it for value (if you get a good deal).
reviews.title: all there in the sq.

reviews.text: I also stayed there about two years ago with my boyfriend, a few problems but nothing that would turn me off staying again. Great location, staff are helpful, food in the restaurant was good and nice atmosphere in the bar.
reviews.title: Friendliest Staff ever!!!

likes.disliked: — They have a late bar and a night club. Younger people would like the nightclub and the latebar is relaxed. More of an older crowd

reviews.text: I completely disagree with the previous negative comments about this hotel. I went there as part of a hen party of 20 ranging in age from mid 20s to late 30s. We could not have asked for more. Everything was well organised with our bookings. Staff were friendly, helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The included breakfast is great and staff are more than happy to modify it to what you want and bring out extra helpings of everything if required (although I have to say they give you plenty in the first place!).
reviews.title: Warm & friendly hotel - excellent location - loved it!

likes.disliked: — everything was great, no complaints at all

reviews.text: I agree that this is not a cheap hotel, but for it's location, service, cleanliness and staff, it is well worth it. We spoke to others staying in other hotels and they were nowhere near as impressed with theirs. I would definitely recommend this hotel, we had a fantastic time here.
reviews.title: much better than reviews would have you believe
Not the worst
reviews.text: We have just arrived back from a three day stay at the Eyre Square Hotel in Galway. This hotel is in a great location right at the edge of Kennedy Park and within a short distance to all the shops. This was a great advantage but it also had its disadvantages, one of which was parking. It cost €8.50 a day to park in the nearby Forrester car park. Another disadvantage was the noise at night time. The first night we arrived we stayed in room 313 which overlooked the main bus depot. This meant that buses were coming and going all the time and we could hear the intercom system quite clearly. This noise went on until late at night and started again at 6am. We requested a change of room and were immediately accommodated. We found the receptionist on duty very pleasant and helpful. We were then moved to room 305 which was an inside room and much quieter but very hot and stuffy. We found the food in the dining room very average but edible. We did notice that they had out of date yougarts at breakfast each morning which we felt was not good enough for a three star hotel. All in all we enjoyed our stay in Galway but if you are looking for good food, luxurious surroundings I would consider a more upmarket hotel.

reviews.title: Stayed in Better Hotels in Galway
reviews.text: I booked this hotel before reading all the negative reviews and I'm glad I decided to see for myself. The rooms were clean and bright. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The breakfasts(both full and buffet) were tasty.We were provided with complementary bottles of water due to water problems in Galway by the hotel. (This was not the case at other hotels ) I would definately stay here again
